reviews.text: As always a great pass time while it is raining outside. Home made style food with good portions, a bit pricy, but well it's the small Switzerland.

For my first night in Latvia,  Lido was an excellent choice. I was able to see what I was choosing.  Signage was in both Latvian and English. Enough English was spoken by the staff that we were able to communicate.  They were able to adjust my portion size, so I didn't feel I was wasting food. Portions were generous and filling. Food choices were simple,  but very adequate.  Staff were friendly and helpful.

This was an interesting place to visit for food as a tourist. It has signs in English so you know what you can choose. There is a mix of hot food, cold food and desserts. It was quite quiet when we went so there wasn't much atmosphere but it was still welcoming
The staff were really tolerant of my lack of speaking Latvian and still helped me pick food by pointing out things which is much appreciated. It was nice to try different types of food
Coffees here are not the best but the quality and tastes of food are pretty good. You can try something regional with not bad prices

have to wait unnecessarily long until a staff member honours you with their attention and serves you the dish you want, as if doing you a favour and as if you're not paying. not much care for the customer. Aside from that the food is decent, and the environment inside and decorations are interesting and possibly authentic Latvian design (I'm a visiting foreigner, so not sure about this)
